actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, and Homeland Security

official_title: To authorize the grant program for elimination of the nationwide backlog in analyses of DNA samples at the level necessary to completely eliminate the backlog and obtain a DNA sample from every person convicted of a qualifying offense.

summary.text: DNA Database Completion Act of 2003 - Amends the DNA Analysis Backlog Elimination Act of 2000 to authorize $100 million for each of FY 2003 through 2007 for grants to eligible States for DNA analyses of samples taken from individuals convicted of a qualifying State offense, and of samples from crime scenes, for inclusion in the Combined DNA Index System.

titles.title: To authorize the grant program for elimination of the nationwide backlog in analyses of DNA samples at the level necessary to completely eliminate the backlog and obtain a DNA sample from every person convicted of a qualifying offense.
